description: 1969 Mustang S Code Convertible, 9R03S ** Last “R03S” mustang built** 49,000 original miles (2k on rebuild) numbers matching engine with orig carb and tag. Nod 9 orig rear (3.0 open), C6 trans has 2k on rebuild, not orig. Orig rad rebuilt. The floors and quarters are orig with no repairs. Car is all Ford sheet metal. RF fender was replaced, ford date coded. Metal work that was done, outer corner of torque boxes weld repaired, upper shock towers and rad support were patched. Work was done by the Shelby Shop. Underneath the car is detailed. This is the last 390 conv mustang to roll off the California assembly line from a 3 year run and documented. Also a San Jose buck tagged car but was never found.

Deluxe Marti report, orig build sheet. Only 251 390 convertibles were built in 1969, B7 export car. 1 of 14 winter blue 390 conv. Winter blue/ blue int. Now Gulf Stream Aqua/white int. Late 1990's resto. Engine bay is clean would need to be detailed and car painted (paint is excellent with a few chips currently) to be 1 condition. Well optioned, power brakes and steering. Deluxe interior, interior and exterior decor group, rare 8k tach, power top with glass. Visibility group, am radio . Most parts are original very little after market parts used. I have owned this car since the mid 90's. Car runs and drives perfectly. No rust. Car has been garaged all its life. Extra steering wheel and orig tooling dash also avail and extra parts. Car is as described with no surprises. New heater core and conv top motor, all gauges work. I will upload pics of underneath the car. Motivated seller.

1969 Ford Mustang Coupe Custom completed in 2017 under 1,000 miles Engine: 351W engine. Hypereutectic pistons with full floating pins. I Beam steel connecting rods. Cylinder heads are Edelbrock proformer RPM, match ported to an Edelbrock Air Gap intake manifold. Camshaft is a roller cam with @570 lift. Street avenger 770 carb. Headers are JBA ceramic coated with a full custom exhaust with X pipe. Every nut and bolt is an ARP. Over 500 horsepower at the flywheel with pump gas Transmission and Rear end: 5 speed Tremec TKO 2 with high performance clutch. Custom ford 9 inch shortened with custom built 4 link with pan-hard bar.

4 wheel disc brakes by Wilwood. Fox 2.0 fully adjustable coil over shocks. Auburn posi with 3:50 gear ratio and 31 spline custom axles. Suspension: Front suspension is PST front and lower control arms with lower/stiffer spring combination. Polygraphite bushings and oversized sway bar. Upper control arms are lowered to the Shelby location. Full frame rails (not subframe connectors) were built to make the car more rigid. Rear suspension is a 4 link with a PanHard bar. Heim joints and poly bushings make the suspension fully adjustable.

Additional details: Car was built with the best components available. Paint color is Dodge Viper blue and a customer silver blend. Car was stripped to bare metal where minimal rust was found as it is an original California car. Drip rail and door handles were shaved, A California Special style spoiler was added. (not originally available of 69 coupe). Interior Beard low back seats, and custom Autometer gauge bezel finish out the interior. Storage bins are now located where the rear seat was. Wheels and Tires: American racing Hopster wheel. 17x8 with BFG 225/65/17 KDW tires in the front. 17x11 with BFG 315/35/17 KDW tires in the rear.  7WER701
By appointment only, please call Roy. 619 708 3180 www.vipclassics.com
1969 Ford Mustang Convertible For Sale in San Marcos, Texas 78666

Get ready for a timeless experience in American made muscle with this 1969 Ford Mustang Convertible!  This two-door pony car features a straight and sporty styling that has become an icon of the automobile industry.  It comes dressed to impress with beautiful red exterior paint that is complimented by a black interior.  Powered by a super rear 390 Cyclone GT V-8 engine (my mechanic says that the engine is a 428) that is mated with automatic transmission, this beautiful classic is eager to get out on the open road.  With approximately 52,000 miles you can be certain that this Mustang will be providing a quality driving experience, laced with power and performance, for many years to come!

The Ford Mustang was introduced to the public in April of 1964, making 1965 the first full year of it's production.  The Mustang nameplate carries a rich legacy because it essentially created the "pony car" class of American automobiles.  With it's sports-car like appearance, long hood, and short rear deck, this vehicle's design gave rise to other competitors such as the the Camaro, Firebird, and Barracuda.  Although some pony cars have seen a revival, the Mustang is the only original pony car to remain in uninterrupted production over five decades of development and revision.  This 1969 Ford Mustang Convertible comes with great features that highlight it's distinctive design and history.

This 1969 Ford Mustang Convertible has been very well maintained.  It is a straight car and a solid driver that is perfect for any true appreciator or collector of classic gems!  This is a must see/drive vehicle to truly appreciate everything it has to offer.  In fact, come see for yourself, but consider yourself warned - She will steal your heart!  Call today for more information on how you can experience a remembrance of simpler times with this lovely Ford Mustang Convertible!!!
Car has been frame off.  every part, lines and wiring new.  302 -5 speed lightly massaged for a great rumble and drive. Has air and new interior with body bezel lines removed.  A drivers Show Car.
Rotisserie Restoration, T-5 Built For The Export Market, Marti Report, GT Model, Sport Deck Rear Seat, Rare

Owner has 4 Mustangs, and loves to drive them! Bought this unique car as the T-5 story is so special of a story. He feels this one on the other hand is just to nice too drive as much, and has decided to sell. Rotisserie Restoration Preformed in early 2000 and completed in 2010. It was purchased from the daughter of the gentleman who had the restoration performed. There we only 173 – 1969 T-5 Fastback built, and they are the rarest of Fastback models! (See Marti Report)
H = Optional 250 H.P. 351 C.I. V8 2 bbl
Our research indicates that a 1968 -1969 Windsor 351 engine should have the following block numbers. If you review pictures 159 – 162 on our website, that may in fact be the numbers on this engine.
Buyer are required- To do their own research to verify the researched codes above are correct.
* The paint is smooth, shiny, and matches well all the way around.
* The paint is definitely high quality, and we don't see any imperfection. The finish is not showing typical orange peel.
* We don't see any scratches in the paint.
* The burgundy stripe is painted on, and professionally done.
* We saw one small nick on the left front wheel well opening, and one below the drivers door handle.
* The body is very straight, and was expertly prepared prior to repaint.
* During the restoration there were some replacement panels used.
* The fits and gaps on the doors, hood, and trunk are fairly consistent. There is a gap on the left side of the trunk that is tighter than usual. (see pics)
* On the drivers door, about a 12 inches down, below the mirror there is a slight dimple.
* In taking random readings around the car on each metal panel, we found that the paint was mostly in the area of 10 to 15 mils. This is common for a quality restoration paint.
* The bright work surrounding the front and side windows all appears to be all fastened and secured firmly. It shows very light wear, and a quality polishing would bring it back to almost new.
* The bright work on the rear window frame, and the molding right below does have slightly more wear and slight pitting, as well as a little scrapping on the right side.
* The front and rear bumpers look like that of a car just a couple years old.
* There is some sealer around the stainless surrounding the fastback window, that may have been to keep moisture out.
* There is some pitting on the gas filler cap assembly, door handles, and the bezel surrounding the grill.
* All four side windows and the rear glass all have the “Car Lite” emblem, and the windshield has no emblem.
* All of the glass looks nice and clear, and we don't see any discoloring, delamination, bull-eyes, cracks, or wiper wear.
* There are a couple of pin head size nicks in the windshield from normal driving.
* The side glass is very clear with only some light scratching, and 3 to 4 light scratches on the rear glass. (see pics)
* The interior looks much as you would expect it to look originally, with the exception of a cassette radio and newer style floor mats.
* The headliner has good color, and all the seams are nice and tight, with a little light wrinkling at the corners in the rear.
* The panels surrounding the interior lights are in place with very close to the same color as headliner.
* The sun visors are matching the headliner and all have good padding inside, and are solid.
* The seats and door panels all look fairly new with good color.
* The carpeting has lots of wear left, and is covered by matching mats.
* The gauges show minimal wear and dirt.
* The last small section of carpet in the cargo area has faded from sun exposure, which is common and could be fairly easily be recolored or replaced if desired.
* There are lap belts and shoulder belts in the front section.
* The base for the gear shift does have light pitting.
* The trunk is all painted, with the correct gas tank mounted in the center.
* The trunk has a nice cut cover, to cover the metal floor.
* The car does include a jack, but does not include a tire and wheel.
* We did not see any cracking on the tires, but we did notice a developing issue on the right rear tire. (see pics)
* The caps, trim rings, and tires appear to have no damage, with the exception of a small scuff on the left front. (see pics)
* Under the hood area looks as it would have been designed, thought it appears to have replacement shocks, a Bosch battery.
* A couple of the clips that are designed to fasten the hood insulation need replaced.
* The floor and the chassis structures do not show any rust perforation that is obvious.
* The bottom was painted during the restoration however with some age you will see some light surface rust on some of the components, but most has held up very well.
* In the area of the rear springs, and their mounting in the front, it looks like there might be a little repair on the box supports in that area. (look carefully at pictures)
* There is little bit of dampness around the oil pan, and possible seepage near rear main, transmission, and the rear end. Nothing much more than normal seepage, and no puddling.
* The right front tie rod boot does have a little split in it, but it is obvious a lot of time and effort went into the bottom side of this vehicle.

Chad drove the car for 10 to 15 miles. The car seemed to run very smooth, and correctly without any improper engine noises. The transmission seemed to up shift, and down shift as it should. Upon braking it seems to stop well, and did not pull to one side or the other and without pulsation. Steering down the road was fairly typical for a gear box, thought it handled the road very nice with the addition of the radial tires. Its a very fun car to drive, and the sound is nice yet not to loud. Owner services car as needed, and changes oil every year. Owner uses non ethanol 91 octane fuel. The odometer section on the title shows “Exempt”.
* Heater temperature levels seem to be working, but the fan is not
* Driver and Passenger vents open and close
* All 4 headlights work on low and high beam
* Left and right, front and back turn signals are working
* Marker lights on rear quarters are both working
* We did not check the emergency brake but we know it does not work correctly

Connecting buyers and sellers of unique vehicles

Auto Connection is a 3rd party agent, assisting both buyers AND sellers. The vehicles they sell are from private owners and collectors, and they provide advertising, marketing, and consulting services for individuals and companies.

The Auto Connection representative has physically viewed the item being sold. The information comes from the seller and other research sources. Auto Connection is not responsible for any misrepresentation by the seller and/or errors in research results, including history statements of vehicle history, repairs, etc.
This vehicle is being sold AS IS and without a warranty, unless otherwise stated.

Information about serial numbers, engine numbers, and any other codes does not guarantee a vehicle's authenticity. These codes and numbers are not guaranteed to be the same as the information on the vehicle ID or vin, trim tag, engine block, cylinder heads, transmission, differential, or other components within this vehicle. Auto Connection does not guarantee documentation, authenticity, repairs, mechanical work, titles, odometer discrepancies, matching numbers, stamped engines, casting numbers, or any other codes, tags, or numbers. The potential for reproduction paper documentation exists, as well as restamped engines and reproduced trim/data tags.

Auto Connection has described this vehicle to the best of their knowledge, but does not guarantee the accuracy of the description. Prospective buyers are encouraged to conduct their own due diligence, including a physical inspection of the vehicle in person, or through a qualified third party inspector/appraiser.

The vehicle will remain for sale until a buyer has placed a deposit on it. This deposit is nonrefundable with the exception of the vehicle being severely misrepresented by Auto Connection or the seller, or stipulated in the Bill of Sale.

It is possible that this vehicle will be sold at a higher price than the highest bid (before or after the auction ends), if the reserve is not met. After the sale (if reserve is met or not), Auto Connection must receive at least a 10% deposit (wire transfer or official bank or cashier's check) within 3 days of the end of the auction (or the Bill of Sale is signed). The high bidder/buyer has 10 days from this time to send the balance in full or final payment and inspect the vehicle (or have a 3rd party professional inspection).

For the most part, the vehicle for sale is not “perfect”. It is unreasonable to assume that every single flaw in the paint, body, engine, etc. or any minor mechanical items (such as a light not working) be considered a reason to refuse the vehicle. Major rust/rot, undisclosed problems with the frame, etc. might constitute a legitimate reason for the buyer to refuse to follow through with the sale. In that situation, the seller and buyer will try to reach an agreeable solution.

The buyer will bear all future costs of repairs or correcting any defects that exist or may occur in the future. Special order Groovy Green exterior paint.
The 1969 Mustang Limited Edition 600 was a special spring 1969, promotion in the Philadelphia area. 508 cars were produced for this promotion which was 92 cars short of the 600 planned.

The cars were available in either Flower Power Red (Ford special paint code WT5185) or Groovy Green (MX8241928). They came in both hardtop and fastback body styles, had the 6 cylinder engine, and many of the hardtops came with a black vinyl top.
Each of the cars received a special Limited Edition 600 decal, which was located under the Mustang emblems on the front fenders.
Colored tape stripes (3 pinstripes just below the body line from the headlight to the quarter panel scoop).

For Ford Mustang, 1969 Was A Year Of Radical Styling Changes. Probably More Sheet Metal Changed Between 1968 And 1969 Than In All Of The Preceding Years.

The Cars Grew In Length As Well As In Performance. By Adding 4 Inches To The Body, It Was The Longest Mustang Built Up To That Time. The Front-End Styling Featured Quad Headlamps, With The High-Beam-Only Center Lamps Relocated To The Outboard Edges Of The Grille.
The Rear Exterior Somewhat Resembled The Concave Style Of 1968. The SportsRoof, However, Had A Spoiler Built Into The Deck Lid And Quarter-Panel Extensions.
High Performance Was The Theme For Ford In 1969 With The Sizzling Mach I Being Among The Line-Up.
Marti Report States Production Of 4,668 Cars With This Engine And Transmission Combination.

Cruise-O-Matic Automatic Transmission With Floor Shift
Paint In Silver Jade With Black/Gold Mach I Side Striping And Blackout Hood Treatment
BFG Raised White Letter Radials On Chrome Five Spoke Mustang Wheels
